In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function `wrap_string` in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(words::AbstractArray, text_width::Int=10)
    res = ""
    for word in words
        if length(res) + length(word) > text_width
            write(STDOUT, "$(res)\n")
            res = "  $(word)"
        elseif isempty(res)
            res = "  $(word)"
        else
            res *= " $word"
        end
    end
    return "$(res)\n"
end
```
You can test the function with an example:

```julia
words = ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet,", "consectetur", "adipiscing", 
         "elit,", "sed", "do", "eiusmod"]

print(wrap_string(words))
```
This will output:

```julia
  Lorem
  ipsum
  dolor
  sit
  amet,
  consectetur
  adipiscing
  elit,
  sed
  do
  eiusmod
```
